no way.translation[0].definitions[0].def: used to emphasize that you will not agree or be able to do something
no way.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: ‘Are you going to offer to work over the weekend?’ ‘No way!’
No way will we be finished by five o'clock.
There’s no way I’m going to pay £500 just for a weekend in Paris.
no way.translation[1].definitions[0].def: used to say that you will definitely not do or allow something
no way.translation[1].definitions[0].not: No way José! (=used to emphasize that you will not do something)
no way.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: There’s no way I’ll ever get married again.
no way.translation[1].definitions[1].def: used to say that you do not believe something or are very surprised by it
